job_title: Housing Support Officer in London, England
pros: Good Management, staff, training and no day is the same.
cons: They have an on call shift, which is not paid well.

pros: Enjoyed my time there, training really good.
cons: Not paid enough. Dreadful out of hours system in which you can be called all hours in the night and weekend.

review_title: A chance to make a difference
pros:
A chance to give something back to the community and make a difference.
The biggest charity helping homeless and vulnerable people in the Surrey area.
Supportive management and friendly colleagues.
Great training programme and good opportunities for career progression.
cons:
Funding cuts mean we are always trying to do more for less.
Working for a charity means we don't get huge bonuses and glam offices - but we do get a chance to help people, which is extremely rewarding.

job_title: Supported Housing Worker in Woking, England
pros: Good ethos, supportive management, a "can do" attitude, no two days the same. Top management listen to their staff & take on board suggestions for improvements.
cons: As everywhere in the charity sector, pay is not great, although is improving again (just had our 1st pay rise in 5 years!)

job_title: Housing and Support Deputy Manager in Woking, England
pros: They nurture staff and help people to develop and progress, there’s good annual leave, generous benefits and opportunity for promotion.
cons: Didn’t want to leave but there wasn’t enough money for me to stay!
